document.docAuthor: Oliveira, Fábio G. L., Cipola, Nikolas G. & Almeida, Eduardo A. B.
document.docTitle: Salina bellinii Oliveira¹ & Cipola² & Almeida¹ 2020, sp.n.
document.masterDocTitle: Systematics and biogeography of Salina MacGillivray (Collembola: Entomobryoidea), with emphasis on the species groups in the New World

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Systematics and biogeography of Salina MacGillivray (Collembola: Entomobryoidea), with emphasis on the species groups in the New World

subSubSection.paragraph: Figures 9 B , 10B , 11B , 12B , 13B , 14A and D , 15B , 16B , 17 C-D, 18B, 19E ZooBank: http://zoobank.org/ B4A5BAD7-4B35-474A-8080-775A42B2F5EE

Body with scarce blue pigmentation, usually on lateral; Ant I with 3–4 mac; cephalic groove only with ciliate chaetae; Th II–Abd I with 2–5, 5–9, 2–4 central mac, respectively; Abd III with 6 lateral mac ( a7 , am6 , pm6 , p6 , p7i and one unnamed); Abd IV with 8 central mac ( A3–5 absent) and 10 lateral mac; collophore with 7 anterior,
2 posterior and 10 lateral flap chaetae; trochanteral organ with 13 spine-like chaetae; manubrial plate with 2–3 chaetae.

subSubSection.paragraph: Total length (head + trunk) of holotype 1.53 mm. Specimens pale white with dark blue pigments on Ant I–IV, strongly on anterior head, intersegmental areas of antenna and Th II to Abd III ; and one longitudinal inner spot on all tibiotarsi. Eyepatches black ( Figure 9B ).

Head. Ant I dorsally with 3–4 mac (one outer distal present or absent) and 5 basal spiny smooth mic ( Figure 10B ). Posterior labial chaetotaxy series ‘CG’ with 6 ciliate chaetae (
CG 1-3
,
CG 5
,
CG 7–7e
); series ‘PLM’ with 2 ciliate chaetae (
PLM 1–2
); series ‘PLE’ with 2 ciliate chaetae (
PLE 1–2
); lateral side with about 14 ciliate chaetae ( Figure 11B ).

Dorsal chaetotaxy. Th II with 2–5 ‘p’ mac ( p1–4 ), p1i , p2 and p4 present or absent. Th III with 5–9 ‘p’ mac ( p1–5 ), p1i2 , p2a , p3p and p4 present or absent ( Figure12B ).Abd I with1‘a’ mac( a3 )and2–3‘p’ mac( m3–5 ), a3 and m5 present or absent ( Figure 13B ). Abd III with 1 ‘a’ mac ( a7 ), 2 ‘m’ mac ( am6 , pm6 ), and 3 ‘p’ mac ( p6 , p7i and one unnamed) (similar to
S. brasiliana
sp.n.
, Figure 14A ). Abd IV with 2 ‘A’ mac ( A1 , A6 ); 1 ‘Ae’ mac ( Ae1 ); 3 ‘B’ mac ( B3–5 ); 1 ‘Be’ mac ( Be1 ); 1 ‘C’ mac ( C1) ; 4 ‘E’ mac ( E1-4 ); 4 ‘F’ mac ( F1–F3p ); 2 ‘Fe’ mac ( Fe1–3 ); posterior side with 3 sens type IV ( ps and two unnamed) (similar to
S. brasiliana
sp.n.
, Figure 14D ). Abd V with 3 ‘a’ mac ( a3 , a5–6 ); 4–5 ‘m’ mac ( m0 , m2–3 , m5–5a ), m0 present or absent; and 3 ‘p’ mac ( p1 , p3–4 ) ( Figure 15B ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Appendages. Trochanteral organ with 13 smooth spine-like chaetae ( Fig 16B ). Collophore anterior side with 2 subapical mac of unequal length and 1 median mes, and 4 proximal smooth mic; posterior side with 1 apical and 1 subapical smooth chaetae; lateral flap formula 2(s), 3(m), 5(i) smooth chaetae, 1 median and 3 inferior larger ( Figures 17 C-D). Manubrial plate with 2–3 chaetae ( Figure 19C ). Mucro with 3–4 teeth ( d1 , ap , v1-2 ), v2 teeth present or absent ( Figure 19E ).
The species epithet honors our friend Dr. Bruno C. Bellini, Collembola researcher from Brazil .

Salina bellinii
sp.n.
resembles
S. tristani Denis, 1931
and
S. zhangi
by general morphology, including scarce pigmentation on Ant, trunk laterally and legs, dorsal chaetotaxy of Th II–Abd I with more than 2, 5, 2 central mac, respectively, and Abd IV with 8 central mac (see Denis 1931 ; Mari-Mutt 1987b ; Soto-Adames 2010 ; Bellini & Cipola 2017 ). However,
S. bellinii
sp.n.
differs from these species by cephalic groove only with ciliate chaetae (2 serrated mic in
S. zhangi
), trochanteral organ with 13 spine-like chaetae ( 14 in
S. tristani
and 17 in
S. zhangi
), and collophore with 7 anterior chaetae (2 mac unequal and 1 mes), 2 posterior chaetae and lateral flap with 10 chaetae. In
Salina zhangi
has 9–10 anterior chaetae (2 mac unequal, without mes), 5–6 posterior chaetae and lateral flap with 14 chaetae, while
S. tristani
4–5 posterior chaetae.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The dorsal chaetotaxy of
S. bellinii
sp.n.
differs by absence of m1 , p1p , p5 on Th II, p1p and p2p on Th III , and a1 and a2 on Abd I (generaly present in
S. tristani
and
S. zhangi
). The Abd III of
S. bellinii
sp.n.
differs by 6 lateral mac (6 or less in
S. zhangi
) and Abd IV with 10 lateral mac ( 7 in
S. tristani
and 9 in
S. zhangi
). For additional information, refer to Table 2 .
